definition: A unit of time commonly used in business and finance to refer to a specific period of three consecutive months. It is often utilized for reporting financial results, analyzing market trends, and evaluating performance.

examples.english: The company released its quarterly figures.

examples.german: Der Umsatz stieg im letzten Quartal um 10 Prozent.
examples.english: Revenue increased by 10 percent in the last quarter.

examples.german: Die Firma plant, im nächsten Quartal neue Produkte einzuführen.
examples.english: The company plans to introduce new products in the next quarter.

examples.german: Der Gewinn im dritten Quartal übertraf die Erwartungen der Analysten.
examples.english: The profit in the third quarter exceeded analysts' expectations.
